title: Web-Based Educational Course for Neonatal Skull Ultrasound Interpretation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and understanding of neonatal intensive care management
context.additional_context: Practical educational course for pediatric and neonatal-perinatal medicine specialists working in NICUs. Blended learning design combining web-based learning (WBL) modules and project-based learning conducted in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can identify key anatomical structures in neonatal cranial ultrasound (CUS) images with 80% accuracy.
Learners can diagnose and classify the five major types of brain injuries (e.g., intracranial hemorrhage, ventricular dilation) found in CUS with 90% accuracy.
After interpreting CUS results, learners can apply appropriate clinical management plans to team-based projects with at least 70% engagement.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
